outline:
1. to put, place, set, appoint, make
    1. (Qal)
      1. to put, set, lay, put or lay upon, lay (violent) hands on
      2. to set, direct, direct toward
        1. to extend (compassion) (fig)
      3. to set, ordain, establish, found, appoint, constitute, make, determine, fix
      4. to set, station, put, set in place, plant, fix
      5. to make, make for, transform into, constitute, fashion, work, bring to pass, appoint, give
    2. (Hiphil) to set or make for a sign
    3. (Hophal) to be set
kjv_def: [idiom] any wise, appoint, bring, call (a name), care, cast in, change, charge, commit, consider, convey, determine, [phrase] disguise, dispose, do, get, give, heap up, hold, impute, lay (down, up), leave, look, make (out), mark, [phrase] name, [idiom] on, ordain, order, [phrase] paint, place, preserve, purpose, put (on), [phrase] regard, rehearse, reward, (cause to) set (on, up), shew, [phrase] stedfastly, take, [idiom] tell, [phrase] tread down, (over-)turn, [idiom] wholly, work.
strongs_def: to put (used in a great variety of applications, literal, figurative, inferentially, and elliptically)
